com.yantra.ycp.ui.io

Interface YCPWeighingScaleConnector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    YCPToledoPSImpl

    public interface YCPWeighingScaleConnector
    This interface is used by Yantra application to communicate with the weighing scale. Yantra provides the implementation for the Mettler Toledo PS weighing scales. Additional weighing scale connectors can be built by implementing this interface and configuring those within Yantra system.
    During initialization the init method is called once by the YCPWeighingFactory. At init time, a config XML is passed to this connector. Format of this XML is 
        <DeviceParamsXML>
        <Attributes>
            <Attribute Name="ClassName" Value="" />
            <Attribute Name="PortId" Value="" />
            <Attribute Name="BaudRate" Value="" />
            <Attribute Name="DataBits" Value="" />
            <Attribute Name="StopBits" Value="" />
            <Attribute Name="Parity" Value="" />
            <Attribute Name="FlowIn" Value="" />
            <Attribute Name="FlowOut" Value="" />
            <!-- other extended attributes specific to weighing scale connector implementations -->
            <Attribute Name="" Value="" />
        </Attributes>
    </DeviceParamsXML>

    This XML is also stored along with this class name in Yantra config database.
    An example is given below: 
        public class CustomScaleConnector implements YCPWeighingScaleConnector {
                  //This assumes that the weigh scale is connected through the serial port. You 
                        will need to write custom code to support other ports such as USB.
        private YFCSerialIO sio;
        private YFCPortConfig config;

        public CustomScaleConnector() {
        }

        public void init(YFCElement configEle) {
            sio = new YFCSerialIO();
            String portId = configEle.getAttribute("PortId");
            config = new YFCPortConfig(PortId);
        }

        public double getWeight() {
            sio.openConnection(config);
            sio.write("W"); // command to get weight from the scale
            sio.waitForResponse(20, 1000); // sleep 20ms. every time and timeout out after 1 sec.
            String response = sio.read();
            return processResponse(response);
        }

        private double processResponse(String response) {
            double weight = -1;
            // process the response appropriately
            return weight;
        }
 
        public void resetScale() {
            // send reset command if required
        }

    }

    NOTE: Implementation of this interface must ensure that an instance can be reused across invocations. YCPWeighingFactory calls init once and subsequently reuses the same instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getWeight()
      Main method to get weight from the scale.
      void init(com.yantra.yfc.dom.YFCElement configElement)
      Called once by the YCPWeighingFactory during initialization.
      void resetScale()
      Called whenever the scale needs to be reset.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(com.yantra.yfc.dom.YFCElement configElement)
        Called once by the YCPWeighingFactory during initialization.
        Parameters:
        configElement - Configuration XML for this connector. Format is upto the designer of this connector implementation. This XML is stored along with the class name within Yantra config database.

      • getWeight

        double getWeight()
        Main method to get weight from the scale. Called everytime application needs to retrieve weight from the scale.
        Returns:
        Weight obtained from the scale

      • resetScale

        void resetScale()
        Called whenever the scale needs to be reset. This call is optional and the actual implementation depends on the scale that is used.
